alert.note: Alert for Northern Wasatch Front (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 29 at 3:14AM MST until January 29 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON MST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 15 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. * WHERE...Northern Wasatch Front. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 7 PM this evening to noon MST Monday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 11 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions can be expected. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial 511.
